channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An appeals court throws out a massive civil fraud penalty against President Trump
item.description: Trump, in a social media post, claimed "total victory" after the ruling, which spares him from a potential half-billion-dollar fine for decades of exa...

item.title: Artificial light has essentially lengthened birds' day
item.description: Millions of audio recordings of hundreds of bird species have revealed that artificial light is making the birds wake up earlier and go to bed later.

item.title: With Fed under pressure, Jerome Powell prepares for a high-stakes speech
item.description: The Fed chair will speak Friday at an annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo. The speech comes as the central bank is under mounting pressure ...

item.title: Walmart says tariff costs are rising 'each week' and will continue
item.description: The world's largest retailer — like many others — has been absorbing most of the increased costs, but raising prices of some goods.

item.title: Hurricane Erin brings flooding to parts of Outer Banks as it pivots from East Coast
item.description: The storm flooded parts of North Carolina's Outer Banks, including a section of the main highway. It's now turning away from the East Coast, but dange...

item.title: What Trump’s crime crackdown in DC looks like in photos
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Pedestrians walk their dogs past parked military vehicles. Commuters move past National Guards at metro stations.

item.title: Israel tells medics and aid groups to prepare for Gaza City evacuation
item.description: Gaza's Hamas-run health ministry says it rejects "any step that would undermine what remains of the health system".

item.title: French streamer's death 'not due to trauma', autopsy finds
item.description: The online personality known as Jean Pormanove was found dead in his home in Nice on Monday.

item.title: Appeals court throws out Trump's $500m civil fraud penalty
item.description: In its 323-page ruling, the New York judges stated that the fine was excessive, and likely violated the US Constitution.

item.title: Privacy and civil rights groups urge US colleges to end campus surveillance to protect protesters
Almost half of adults say they are ordering kids' meals. Here's why.
item.description: Adult customers admit to ordering from kids' menus to save money and eat smaller portions, a new survey shows.

item.title: Apple hikes the cost of a monthly Apple TV+ subscription
item.description: Apple's move to raise the cost of its streaming platform follows similar moves by Netflix and Peacock.

item.title: UK backs call for Israel to allow foreign media into Gaza
item.description: Governments from 27 countries, including France and Germany, say journalists in Gaza must be protected.

item.title: If a Putin-Zelensky summit takes place, where could it be?
item.description: Geneva, Istanbul and Budapest have been put forward as potential locations - but bilateral talks still remain a long way off.

item.title: WNBA breaks single-season attendance record
item.description: The Women's National Basketball Association announced it broke its record for attendance during a single season, attracting more than 2.5 million fans...

item.title: Woman charged with murder after using abortion pill details claims against D.A.
item.description: Lizelle Gonzalez was indicted on murder charges in 2022, after she used medication to induce an abortion. The charges were later dropped.

item.title: Trump to join Washington patrol while feds deploy checkpoints around city
Data centers face staffing crisis as demand soars for trade workers
item.description: With roughly 400,000 trade jobs unfilled in the U.S., data centers powering the AI boom face a staffing crisis.
